title: Hillary Clinton Raised $37 Million in Last 3 Months
snippet: Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaign raised $37 million in the three-month period that ended Dec. 31, bringing her total war chest for use in the Democratic presidential contest to more than $112 million.

title: How Jeb Bush Hopes to Save His Candidacy
snippet: Rival campaigns seem to be counting him out, but Mr. Bush’s allies have a long-shot plan they hope will win him the Republican nomination.

title: Obama to Consider Executive Actions on Gun Violence
snippet: President Obama will meet with Attorney General Loretta E. Lynch on Monday to discuss what he can do to curb gun violence, sidestepping an entrenched Congress.

title: U.S. Doesn’t Know How Many Foreign Visitors Overstay Visas
snippet: After two decades of failed attempts to track such visitors, some officials call the visa program a critical national security weakness.

title: Bernie Sanders Took In $33 Million in Last Quarter
snippet: Senator Bernie Sanders’s presidential campaign took in more than $33 million in the final three months of the 2015, as his wide base of small donors enabled him to raise just $4 million less than his rival Hillary Clinton in their fight for the De...

title: For Donald Trump, Lessons From a Brother’s Suffering
snippet: Mr. Trump, whose appeal is predicated on an aura of toughness and perpetual success, seldom speaks of his brother Freddy, who died as an alcoholic in 1981 at age 43.

title: F.D.A. Regulator, Widowed by Cancer, Helps Speed Drug Approval
snippet: Dr. Richard Pazdur, the Food and Drug Administration’s oncology chief, says his wife’s ordeal was influential in a change that many had advocated but that critics say erodes safeguards.

title: State Focus and Infusion of Funding Buoy Gun Control Advocates
snippet: With tens of millions of dollars in contributions to spend, groups are looking to toughen state and local measures in ways that the Republican-led Congress has rejected on the federal level.

title: ‘Dark’ Funds May Bode Ill in 2016 Election
snippet: Contributions to entities that are not required to disclose their donors topped more than $300 million in the 2012 presidential race, and some experts believe that the levels may be far higher this time.

title: G.O.P. Candidates Warn of Obama’s Actions on Guns
snippet: The Republican presidential candidates hoping to succeed President Obama are accusing him of abusing power through executive orders on guns and promising to reverse such measures if elected.

title: Bernie Sanders, Needing Early Lift, Builds Iowa Ground Operation
snippet: His campaign has assembled an extensive effort for the crucial Feb. 1 caucuses, with 100 paid staff members and volunteer leaders.

title: Donald Trump Shrugs Off Appearance in Terrorist Video
snippet: Donald J. Trump said there was little he could do about his appearance in a recruitment video that was posted by the terrorist group Shabab.

title: Ted Cruz’s Iowa Bus Tour: A Daughter’s Tantrum, and a Lesson
snippet: Senator Ted Cruz recalled a tantrum from his then-three-year-old daughter Caroline, and used it as an allegory for America.

title: Bipartisan Criminal Justice Overhaul Is Haunted by Willie Horton
snippet: The 1988 presidential campaign that saw the furlough of a Massachusetts inmate has helped stall legislation that has support from both parties.

title: Donald Trump Finally Buys TV Ads, and Lots of Them
snippet: Donald J. Trump had promised to spend at least $2 million a week on advertising, and he has already reserved nearly that much through Jan. 12.

title: Jim McDermott, Democrat of Washington, Won’t Seek Re-election to the House
snippet: Mr. McDermott, one of the most liberal members of the House and a senior member of the Ways and Means Committee, announced he would retire at the end of his 14th term this year.

title: Verbatim: Hillary Clinton Won’t Respond to Donald Trump’s ‘Alternate Reality’
snippet: Hillary Clinton says she won’t respond to Donald J. Trump’s “alternate reality.”

title: Ted Cruz’s Iowa Bus Tour: Billybob’s Beef Brisket and the N.S.A.
snippet: Ted Cruz’s microphone went out during his second stop on his Iowa bus tour, and President Obama and the National Security Agency took the blame.

title: Hillary Clinton Tells Democrats in Iowa: ‘I Need You’
snippet: At the start of a two-day tour of the state, Hillary Clinton said she would seek to improve the Affordable Care Act and backed the president’s proposed executive action on gun control.

title: Obama to Expand Gun Background Checks and Tighten Enforcement
snippet: President Obama’s executive actions on guns will stop short of the kind of large-scale changes that he unsuccessfully sought from Congress three years ago.

title: Ted Cruz’s Iowa Bus Tour: Making a Favorite Joke in Boone
snippet: Stop No.1 on Ted Cruz’s 28-town swing of Iowa features a favorite joke.

title: Donald Trump, in First Ad, Plays to Fears on Immigration and ISIS
snippet: Shrouded in darkness, the ad trumpets Mr. Trump’s call to bar Muslims from entering the United States and promises a wall on the Mexican border.

title: First Draft Focus: In the Swing of Things
snippet: Hillary Clinton held a town-hall-style meeting in Sioux City, Iowa, on Tuesday, the second day of a two-day swing through the state before the Iowa caucuses on Feb. 1.

title: Bernie Sanders Attacks Hillary Clinton Over Regulating Wall Street
snippet: The senator said that his rival was too cozy with the financial industry and that his regulatory proposals were bigger and bolder.

title: Ted Cruz’s Iowa Bus Tour: A Fawning Joke for a Key Supporter
snippet: Ted Cruz indirectly links one of his most prominent supporters to Superman, through pajamas.

title: Steve Israel of New York, a Top House Democrat, Won’t Seek Re-election
snippet: Representative Israel, an eight-term member, has been a close adviser to Nancy Pelosi and led the party’s campaign efforts in 2012 and 2014.

title: Group Backing Marco Rubio Unleashes Ads Attacking Chris Christie
snippet: In one ad, the political action committee accuses Mr. Christie, his emerging rival, for being a liberal who is too friendly with President Obama.

title: Ted Cruz’s Iowa Bus Tour: A Blind Man Walks Into a Library …
snippet: Ted Cruz finds a supporter with a sense of history, and humor.

title: Obama on Newtown and Gun Control
snippet: Shedding tears over the 2012 deaths of children in a Newtown, Conn., elementary school, the president announced executive actions he will take on gun laws.

title: Chris Christie Differentiates Black Lives Matter From 1960s Unrest
snippet: Gov. Chris Christie, who typically trumpets his law-and-order credentials as a former federal prosecutor to prove his toughness to voters, used unusually soft language and conveyed empathy as he dealt with a question about the Black Lives Matter m...

title: Republican Candidates Tread Carefully to Oregon Protest Standoff
snippet: The Republican Party is one that espouses the virtues of limited government, but this year’s group of presidential candidates is treading carefully as a standoff between authorities and armed antigovernment protesters in Oregon drags on.

title: Obama’s Action on Guns: What It Means for Background Checks
snippet: The president’s action clarifies existing rules on the sale of firearms and includes efforts to link mental health records with criminal background checks.

title: U.S. Sends Two Guantánamo Detainees to Ghana
snippet: The transfer of the two Yemenis represented the first time that lower-level detainees had been resettled in sub-Saharan Africa.

title: Ted Cruz’s Iowa Bus Tour: Loaded Pizza, and Loaded Guns
snippet: Mr. Cruz visited a Godfather’s Pizza in Spirit Lake and, when asked about gun rights, recounted a tale of a woman who had been pulled over while carrying a derringer in her boot.

title: House Votes to Send Bill to Repeal Health Law to Obama’s Desk
snippet: The House voted for the 62nd time to repeal the Affordable Care Act, in effect forcing a rare veto from the president to protect his signature domestic achievement.

title: Ted Cruz’s Iowa Bus Tour: Coffee, Cookies and a Song
snippet: In Sibley, Iowa, Ted Cruz lampooned the anodyne “issues” pages populating most candidates’ websites.

title: Paul Ryan Acts to Repeal Obamacare
snippet: House speaker Paul D. Ryan announced on Wednesday that a bill to repeal the Affordable Care Act had passed both houses of Congress. President Obama is all but guaranteed to veto it.

title: Ted Cruz’s Iowa Bus Tour: The ‘Crazy Nutcase’ With the Nuclear Bomb
snippet: Ted Cruz, reacting to North Korea’s claim that it tested a hydrogen bomb, offered his appraisal of the country’s leader, Kim Jong-un, calling him a “crazy nutcase.”

title: Chris Christie Taking High Road in Ad Responding to Marco Rubio
snippet: Much as he has done in the debates, Mr. Christie tries in his new ad to draw a contrast not with his Republican presidential rivals, but with Hillary Clinton.

title: Donald Trump Keeps Pushing Ted Cruz Citizenship Issue
snippet: Donald J. Trump continued to fan the flames of doubt over Senator Ted Cruz’s citizenship, suggesting that the Texas senator’s Canadian roots might be a problem if he won the Republican presidential nomination.

title: A Day of Policy, Dropped Guards and Rancor
snippet: In a campaign that has been overshadowed and altered by Donald J. Trump, the debate has focused heavily on immigration and on a general disgust with Washington. But Tuesday was a rare day that was thick with policy substance and increased tensions...

title: Avoiding the Dreaded ‘Second-Term Curse’
snippet: Political observers say that President Obama appears to have avoided the pitfalls that often undermine a second presidential term.

title: An Ice Cream Mogul and His Fellow Burlingtonians React to a Trump Rally
snippet: In a liberal enclave fiercely loyal to Bernie Sanders, Burlington’s former mayor, residents were amazed and perplexed by Donald J. Trump’s planned rally on Thursday night.

title: Bill Clinton, Back in Iowa, Refuses to Respond to Donald Trump
snippet: Bill Clinton returned to the campaign trail in Iowa, where he shied away from questions about Donald J. Trump but embraced topics like renewable energy and confronting allergies.

title: Donald Trump Brings Gridlock to Vermont
snippet: Donald J. Trump brought gridlock to Burlington, Vt., as the police braced for an overflow of thousands of political activists who were certain to be shut out from the candidate’s rally.

title: Ad Wars of 2016 Campaign Erupt in a Changing TV Arena
snippet: Candidates and the outside groups supporting them are betting that television ads will remain a crucial political battlefield when signs increasingly suggest otherwise.

title: Ted Cruz’s Iowa Bus Tour: Using ‘Star Wars’ to Knock the Democrats
snippet: Ted Cruz said that the new “Star Wars” movie was “much more realistic and down-to-earth than whatever the Democrats were talking about” at their last debate.

title: Crowd Gathers to Greet Donald Trump in Bernie Sanders Territory
snippet: A crowd of Trump supporters, hecklers and curious observers braved freezing temperatures to get a glimpse of the Republican presidential candidate who dared to set foot upon the traditionally liberal turf of Bernie Sanders.

title: Ted Cruz’s Iowa Bus Tour: A Momentary Scare
snippet: At a Pizza Ranch in Pocahontas, Iowa, Ted Cruz expressed gratitude about the size of his family, and checked on a woman who briefly fainted, reportedly at the sound of a Democrat’s name.

title: Planned Parenthood, in Its First Primary Endorsement, Backs Hillary Clinton
snippet: Planned Parenthood said that it would endorse Hillary Clinton — its first endorsement in a presidential primary in the nonprofit’s 100-year existence.

title: Marco Rubio Reacts to Those Boots That Were Made for Talking
snippet: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida seemed both disgusted and amused by the worldwide attention that have bee given to his sleek high-heel boots.

title: Marco Rubio Aims New TV Ad at Iowa’s Evangelical Voters
snippet: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida, a Roman Catholic, addresses his faith in the ad as he tries to slow the momentum of Senator Ted Cruz in Iowa.

title: Chelsea Clinton, Again Her Mother’s Surrogate, Takes Up the Fight Against Bernie Sanders
snippet: In returning to the presidential campaign trail for the first time since 2008, Chelsea Clinton focused on motherhood and attacked Senator Bernie Sanders over his health care and education proposals.

title: Hillary Clinton’s Lead Over Bernie Sanders Slipping in New Poll
snippet: A New York Times/CBS News poll finds a sharp generational divide within the Democratic Party, with voters under 45 favoring Mr. Sanders.

title: How the Poll Was Conducted
snippet: The latest New York Times/CBS News Poll is based on telephone interviews conducted Jan. 7 through 10 with 1,276 adults throughout the United States. Of those, 1,094 said they were registered to vote.

title: A New York Times/CBS News Poll on the State of the Presidential Race
snippet: The latest New York Times/CBS News national poll finds a significant narrowing of the race for the Democratic nomination while Donald Trump maintains his sizable lead among Republican primary voters.

title: PAC Backing Jeb Bush Counters Campaign Message With Ad Critical of Marco Rubio
snippet: While Jeb Bush is portraying himself as a serious candidate for serious times, the “super PAC” supporting him is running attack ads against Marco Rubio.

title: Hillary Clinton Accuses Bernie Sanders of Not Standing Up to Gun Lobby
snippet: Hillary Clinton, appearing with the president of the Brady Campaign to Prevent Gun Violence, attacked Bernie Sanders on his 2005 vote to shield gunmakers from lawsuits.

title: Chelsea Clinton Campaigns for Hillary
snippet: Chelsea Clinton told an audience in Concord, N.H., that becoming a grandmother has made Hillary Clinton more determined.

title: Hillary Clinton Gets Backing of Food Services Union
snippet: The United Food and Commercial Workers Union will endorse Hillary Clinton, giving the Democratic candidate a welcome boost as polls in Iowa and New Hampshire show Senator Bernie Sanders gaining ground.

title: Ad Backing Jeb Bush Calls Marco Rubio Untrustworthy on Immigration
snippet: Right to Rise, the “super PAC” supporting Jeb Bush, has released its third negative ad criticizing Senator Marco Rubio, this time attacking him over his record on immigration.

title: Supreme Court Strikes Down Part of Florida Death Penalty
snippet: A court majority ruled that juries were not given sufficient say over which inmates should be put to death.

title: Republicans Lead Congress With Two Distinct Agendas
snippet: Secure in his leadership, Speaker Paul D. Ryan has embraced an ambitious agenda, while his counterpart in the Senate, Mitch McConnell, keeps an eye on his tenuous majority.

title: Ted Cruz Didn’t Report Goldman Sachs Loan in a Senate Race
snippet: As Mr. Cruz tells it, loyalty and sacrifice helped finance his 2012 Senate bid in Texas. Turns out, a Goldman Sachs loan did as well.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Intensify Fight over Health, Guns and Costs
snippet: Mr. Sanders hit back on Wednesday as Mrs. Clinton continued to assail his positions on health insurance and gun control.

title: Hillary Clinton Ad Seconds Obama on Guns, Rebuking Bernie Sanders
snippet: In the new 30-second clip, Mrs. Clinton cites her support for the president’s gun-control measures, a indirect reminder of what she has called Mr. Sanders’s reluctance to stand up to the gun industry.

title: Justices Hear Case Over Puerto Rico’s Sovereignty
snippet: The Supreme Court is deciding whether the island is an independent sovereign or a territory, a huge matter of pride and politics.

title: Steve King Faults Nikki Haley’s Conservatism, but Not Her Looks
snippet: While Representative Steve King said he doubted whether Gov. Nikki Haley was a “principled conservative,” he thought she was “beautiful” enough to be the face of the Republican Party.

title: ‘Super PAC’ Backing Jeb Bush Uses Conspiracy-Minded Journalist in Ad
snippet: A journalist who has highlighted conspiracy theories about major news events is quoted in an ad by the “super PAC” supporting Jeb Bush.

title: Paul Ryan Cuts Off Iran Vote in Rebuff to Tardy Lawmakers
snippet: After the House passed legislation bolstering sanctions against Iran, Republican leaders called for a do-over because more than 100 members had not voted.

title: Donald Trump’s Iowa Ground Game Seems to Be Missing a Coach
snippet: Mr. Trump may well win the caucuses, but if he does, it will probably be in spite of his organizing team, which is still committing basic organizing errors.

title: Chris Christie Welcomes Attacks as a Sign of His Strength
snippet: “I love the fact that people are shooting at me,” Gov. Chris Christie, while campaigning in New Hampshire, said of political opponents’ attacks on him.

title: Hillary Clinton’s Campaign Outraged by Bernie Sanders Ad on Wall Street
snippet: Hillary Clinton’s aides expressed outrage over a Bernie Sanders ad that they said violated Mr. Sanders’s pledge to never run a negative attack ad against a political opponent.

title: That Jeb Bush Freight Train? A Wreck, Marco Rubio Allies Chortle
snippet: After Mr. Bush’s “super PAC,” Right to Rise, imagined Mr. Rubio as a weathervane and Mr. Bush as a freight train by comparison, the super PAC behind Mr. Rubio, fired back.

title: Donald Trump’s Popularity Hits New Heights in Latest National Poll
snippet: Donald J. Trump’s popularity has climbed to its highest level to date less than a month before the first Republican votes will be cast, according to a new national NBC/Wall Street Journal poll.

title: New Bernie Sanders Ad, on Wall Street, Fires Back at Hillary Clinton
snippet: The new ad for Senator Bernie Sanders claims that Mrs. Clinton’s plan to regulate Wall Street is disingenuous.

title: Pulled in 2 Directions, Marco Rubio Toughens on Immigration, a Little
snippet: Faced with attacks from Ted Cruz and Donald Trump, Mr. Rubio has pushed stiffer policies, while still supporting a change in the law to offer a path to citizenship to illegal immigrants.

title: Martin O’Malley Makes the Cut for Next Democratic Debate
snippet: Though his low polling numbers raised the possibility he would be excluded from Sunday’s Democratic presidential debate, former Gov. Martin O’Malley of Maryland will be onstage, NBC News said.

title: Verbatim: Barack Obama on Michelle Obama’s Presidential Ambitions
snippet: “Let me tell you, there are three things that are certain in life: death, taxes, and Michelle is not running for president.” — President Obama

title: Ben Carson’s Campaign Finance Chief Quits
snippet: The disarray within Ben Carson’s campaign continued as his campaign’s finance chairman resigned hours before Republican presidential candidates were set to gather in South Carolina for their next debate.

title: Donald Trump Disavows Actions by White Nationalist Promoting His Bid
snippet: Donald J. Trump took the rare step of “disavowing” the endorsement of a prominent white nationalist who supports Mr. Trump’s ban on Muslim immigration and who said the United States needs more white immigrants who can assimilate.

title: How to Watch the Republican Debate
snippet: Seven Republicans will be on the main stage in South Carolina for the party’s sixth nationally televised debate, starting 9 p.m. Thursday on Fox Business Network.

title: Campaign Aides Defend Bernie Sanders’s Record on Gun Votes
snippet: Bernie Sanders opposed keeping background-check records tied to gun purchases for 90 days, putting him at odds with Hillary Clinton.

title: Donald Trump Says He Is Self-Financing Bid, Despite the Evidence
snippet: Donald J. Trump insists he is financing his own campaign, but the evidence suggests otherwise.

title: Gingerly, Donald Trump Tries Out Some Campaign Conventions
snippet: As some polls have tightened and voting nears, Mr. Trump is starting to balance his unique, provocative style with running “the Iowa way” and “the New Hampshire way.”

title: Republicans in Congress Will Write 2016 Campaign Platform, Ryan Says
snippet: They said they would focus on national security, the economy, health care, poverty and the Constitution after a meeting in Baltimore.

title: Marco Rubio Bought a Gun on Christmas Eve, Campaign Says
snippet: Marco Rubio bought a gun on Christmas Eve at a Florida store “packed” with customers, some of whom he said were worried that President Obama would further restrict their gun-buying rights

title: Ted Cruz Failed to Report a Second Campaign Loan in 2012
snippet: A loan from Citibank, in addition to one from Goldman Sachs disclosed this week, should have been reported to the Federal Election Commission.

title: Justices to Hear Appeal by Bob McDonnell, Ex-Governor of Virginia
snippet: The case before the Supreme Court will test what kinds of official conduct amount to forbidden corruption.

title: Trump Returns to Campaigning in Iowa
snippet: At a campaign stop in Iowa, Donald J. Trump spoke about his performance in the debate Thursday night. He also discussed his relationship with evangelicals and the Tea Party.

title: ‘Super Pac’ Backing Jeb Bush Looks to Crowdfund an Ad for the Super Bowl
snippet: Right to Rise, the “super PAC” supporting Jeb Bush, is urging donors to contribute online to run an ad during the Super Bowl, two days before New Hampshire holds its primary on Feb. 9.

title: How I Got Ejected From a Donald Trump Event
snippet: As Donald J. Trump visited a Pizza Ranch restaurant here on Friday, a New York Times reporter was ejected by Trump staff members and a local police officer.

title: Prominent Jeb Bush Donor Questions ‘Super PAC’ Strategist Over Negative Marco Rubio Ads
snippet: At a closed-door meeting Friday, a Jeb Bush donor questioned why the group Right to Rise was spending money attacking Senator Marco Rubio.

title: Ted Cruz Goes on Multipronged Attack Against Donald Trump
snippet: Senator Ted Cruz seemed to have gotten over his reluctance to criticize Donald J. Trump, continuing to tie Mr. Trump to liberal “New York values,” criticizing his temperament and even disparaging his poll numbers.

title: Bernie Sanders’s Vision Makes Hillary Clinton Camp See Red
snippet: Hillary Clinton’s campaign denounced an ad for Bernie Sanders in Iowa and New Hampshire, calling it a negative attack — a characterization Mr. Sanders’s team denied.

title: Clinton Campaign Underestimated Sanders Strengths, Allies Say
snippet: Advisers to Mrs. Clinton, including the former president Bill Clinton, believe that her campaign made serious miscalculations by failing to undercut Mr. Sanders’s message early in the race.

title: Ted Cruz ‘Apologizes’ to New Yorkers, Again and Again
snippet: In a stump speech and several other places, Senator Ted Cruz issued a faux apology to New Yorkers for saying Donald J. Trump has “New York values.”

title: U.S. Pledges to Ease Pain of Closing Coal Mines in Shift to Cleaner Energy
snippet: The administration unveiled a plan aimed at extracting more money from companies for mining on federal land and using that revenue to help coal communities train for new jobs.

title: Looking at Later Primaries, Bernie Sanders Works to Strengthen Black Support
snippet: The Vermont senator faces a daunting problem even if he wins Iowa and New Hampshire: winning over African-American voters in the more diverse states to follow.

title: Dog Pants? Show a Little More Fur, Obama Says
snippet: President Obama gave interviews at the White House on Friday to three popular YouTube figures.

title: Verbatim: Donald Trump Says He Is No Longer Worried About Ted Cruz
snippet: At a campaign rally in Las Vegas, Donald J. Trump said of Ted Cruz, “He had his moment and he blew it.”

title: Republicans Say Government Mismanaged Health Care Co-ops
snippet: Twelve of the 23 health insurance cooperatives set up with $2.5 billion in federal funding have shut down, rather than spur competition as intended.

title: Court Rejects a Bid to Block Coal Plant Regulations
snippet: A lawsuit by at least 27 states to stop the rule, which could eventually shut down hundreds of coal-fired power plants, is to be heard on June 2.

title: Ted Cruz Goes Local in Latest South Carolina Ad
snippet: The senator appeals to the state’s Army-minded voters in a new commercial that highlights his promise to be tough on terrorists by investing more in the military.

title: ‘Midlands’
snippet: A new ad from the Cruz campaign running in South Carolina.

title: Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump Open Up Strong Leads in Iowa, Poll Shows
snippet: Senator Bernie Sanders and Donald J. Trump have opened up solid leads in Iowa less than two weeks before the state’s caucuses kick off the 2016 presidential nominating contests, according to a new poll.

title: Clinton Defends Health Care Plan in Iowa
snippet: During a rally at Simpson College in Indianola, Iowa, the Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton touted her health care plan, saying Senator Bernie Sanders’s plan would end in "gridlock."

title: U.S. Tightens Visa Rules for Some European Visitors
snippet: Travelers who hold dual citizenship from Iran, Iraq, Sudan or Syria, or have visited one of those countries in the last five years, may no longer participate in the visa-waiver program.

title: Hillary Clinton Knocks Bernie Sanders on Iran
snippet: With Bernie Sanders’s domestic message of confronting income inequality giving him momentum here, Hillary Clinton sought to portray him as inexperienced on foreign policy and ill-equipped to address the firestorms erupting in the Middle East.

title: Marco Rubio Steps Up Attacks On Ted Cruz, Calling Him a Flip-Flopper
snippet: Marco Rubio declared Thursday that his Senate colleague Ted Cruz “is not who he says he is,” challenging his sincerity and calling him a flip-flopper.

title: Donald Trump Blasts Ted Cruz Using the Senator’s Own Words
snippet: Mr. Trump, in a new negative commercial, assails Mr. Cruz over immigration using footage from Mr. Cruz’s past that shows him uncomfortable and off-script.

title: With Calm and Experience, John Kasich Connects in New Hampshire
snippet: After appearing lost in a crowded Republican field, the Ohio governor has been enjoying a wave of attention in the first primary state as a serious and nonangry candidate.

title: Trump on National Review’s Criticism
snippet: The Republican presidential candidate Donald J. Trump said the National Review was a "dying paper" and accused the magazine of trying to get publicity when it published an editorial criticizing him.

title: Chris Christie to Return to New Jersey to Prepare for Snowstorm
snippet: Gov. Chris Christie scrapped his plans to wait out the expected snowstorm in New Hampshire on Friday and instead headed back to his home state of New Jersey to oversee a potential worse weather emergency there.

title: House Democrats Prepare for Retreat, and a Few Laughs
snippet: House Democrats will huddle next week in Baltimore at a three-day strategy session that will include speeches by President Obama, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and the comedian Trevor Noah.

title: Hillary Clinton Defends Speaking Fees Paid by Wall Street Firms
snippet: Hillary Clinton told an Iowa newspaper that she has no regrets about the millions of dollars in fees she has made by giving speeches to banking and financial companies. “Anybody who thinks they can buy me doesn’t know me,” she said.

title: Group Backing Jeb Bush Draws on ‘Jeopardy’ to Attack John Kasich
snippet: Right to Rise, the “super PAC” supporting Mr. Bush, uses Mr. Kasich’s record as a governor and congressman from Ohio to paint him as out of step with New Hampshire values.

title: Trump Criticizes Bush Ad
snippet: In response to Jeb Bush’s ad saying Donald J. Trump would lose the election to Hillary Clinton, Mr. Trump called his rival a “poor, pathetic, low-energy guy.”

title: Donald Trump, Challenging Political Correctness, Strikes a Chord
snippet: Donald J. Trump has regained momentum in Iowa two weeks before the state’s caucuses, and many voters cite his bravado and willingness to assail political correctness, more than his policy proposals, as the main reasons.

title: Does Jeb Bush Want His Family’s Help? It’s Hard to Say, Even for Him
snippet: A glimpse into a political family’s dynamics, as Jeb Bush is asked on the campaign trail why he isn’t using his brother George W. and father, George — two former presidents — to bolster his own cause in the 2016 race.

title: In Support of Ted Cruz, Glenn Beck Slams Donald Trump
snippet: Appearing at a mostly full college gymnasium in Iowa, Mr. Beck delivered a forceful case for Mr. Cruz as the only viable option for conservatives.

title: Des Moines Register Endorses Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton
snippet: The Register, the largest newspaper in Iowa, announced Saturday night that it had endorsed Senator Marco Rubio in the Republican race and Hillary Clinton in the Democratic race.

title: Donald Trump Would ‘Love’ to See Michael Bloomberg Run
snippet: Donald Trump called Michael Bloomberg, a former mayor of New York, a friend and said he would “love the competition” in the presidential race.

title: ‘Hillarycare’ Failed, but Hillary Clinton Reminds Voters She Tried
snippet: While criticizing Senator Bernie Sanders’ universal health care plan as impractical, Hillary Clinton is reminding voters she tried something similar during her husband’s first term.

title: Negative Words for Negative Ads From Bush-Aligned ‘Super PAC’
snippet: At a town-hall-style event in New Hampshire, a Jeb Bush supporter complained of being inundated with mailers attacking Mr. Bush’s opponents.

title: No Split Between Simon and Garfunkel Over Bernie Sanders’s Use of Their Song
snippet: In a CNN interview, Art Garfunkel said that the idea to use “America” in an ad came from the campaign, and that the duo, both liberal-leaning, “acquiesced” to the request.

title: One Republican Candidate Wouldn’t Mind Seeing Michael Bloomberg in the Race
snippet: Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio, who has been appealing to centrist voters in New Hampshire, called Mr. Bloomberg a “good mayor” and said, “If he wants to run, he probably will stimulate the debate.”

title: Ted Cruz Condemns Donald Trump for His Use of Eminent Domain
snippet: In a new ad, Senator Cruz attacks Mr. Trump over a decades-old battle to expand his casino in Atlantic City, portraying his wealth as a product of government overreach.

title: Their Boss Stays on the Sideline, but Obama Aides Tilt to Clinton
snippet: The White House is working with Hillary Clinton’s campaign in ways large and small. Their two staffs consult on issues and the positions she takes on the president’s policy priorities.

title: Storage of Records of Background Checks Shifted After Last Year’s Security Breach
snippet: A major component of the overhaul will be the creation of a new agency that will process federal background checks, called the National Background Investigations Bureau.

title: Pentagon Wants Psychologists to End Ban on Interrogation Role
snippet: The American Psychological Association has been asked to revisit its “blanket prohibition” on the involvement of psychologists in national security interrogations.

title: Donald Trump Hears a Lesson in Humility at Church
snippet: Mr. Trump attended a church service in Iowa on Sunday and later told people at a rally that “we talked about humility in church today.”

title: Chris Christie Warns New Hampshire Against Voting for Donald Trump
snippet: Mr. Christie warned voters against using their vote as an “expression of anger” against Washington, saying that voting for Donald J. Trump could lead to Hillary Clinton winning the presidency.

title: Republicans Risk Repeating Mistake on Hispanic Vote
snippet: Demographic trends and the outcome of the 2012 presidential election don’t bode well for a Republican approach highlighting hostility to immigration.

title: Chris Christie Attacks Marco Rubio Over Blizzard Remark
snippet: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey angrily scolded Senator Marco Rubio Sunday for his sarcastic remark about the blizzard that crippled much of the Northeast this weekend, calling it a sign of his “immaturity” and inexperience.

title: Hillary Clinton Says Senator Charles Grassley Wants ‘to Defeat Me’
snippet: Hillary Clinton on Sunday accused Iowa’s senior Republican senator, Charles E. Grassley, of trying to undermine her presidential candidacy by leaking negative information about her tenure as secretary of state.

title: Candidates React to Bloomberg With Dismissals and Differences
snippet: The presidential candidates greeted word of Michael R. Bloomberg’s possible presidential run with attacks on his record, and in some cases, praise for the former mayor.

title: In Return to Iowa, Bernie Sanders Picks Up Where He Left Off on Wall Street and Clinton
snippet: Mr. Sanders told supporters that he does better than Hillary Clinton in national polls versus Donald J. Trump, and that it was making Wall Street nervous.

title: A Day of Endorsements for Presidential Candidates in Iowa
snippet: The Des Moines Register backed Senator Marco Rubio of Florida for the Republicans; and Hillary Clinton for the Democrats. And Senator Charles E. Grassley shared a stage with Donald J. Trump.

title: Bernie Sanders Courts Elusive Voters: Young Iowans
snippet: Mr. Sanders has struck a chord with young people, but his campaign acknowledges that beating Hillary Clinton in Iowa will require overcoming their history of dismal attendance.

title: Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump Far Ahead in New Hampshire, Poll Finds
snippet: A poll released Monday showed Mr. Sanders and Mr. Trump with commanding leads two weeks before the New Hampshire primary.

title: Bernie Sanders, Backed by Image of a Bright Horizon, Lays Out His Vision
snippet: In highly idealistic terms, Mr. Sanders details his goals and appeals to Iowans a week before their presidential caucuses.

title: Seeking to End Gerrymandering’s Enduring Legacy
snippet: Advocates in several states are trying to change the strict political control of the congressional map-drawing process, which has a long history.

title: Hillary Clinton, Battling in Iowa, Turns Warm Under Pressure
snippet: In trying to win the Iowa caucuses in a race that has become much tougher than she expected, Mrs. Clinton has tried to be more open and personable with Iowans.

title: Hillary Clinton Gets Personal on Christ and Her Faith
snippet: At an event in Iowa, Mrs. Clinton elaborated on her views on Christianity and the Bible, a subject she rarely talks about when campaigning.

title: As Iowa Caucuses Near, Jeb Bush Goes to Nevada
snippet: Six days before the Iowa caucuses, Mr. Bush plans to campaign in Elko, Nev., to show Nevadans that his campaign is taking their state seriously.

title: Bernie Sanders Mailing in Iowa Defends His Record on Guns
snippet: The Sanders campaign has mailed Iowa voters literature that outlines his record on gun control, suggesting how much he is on the defensive on the issue with the caucuses only a week away.

title: Bill de Blasio Not Keen on a Bloomberg Presidential Run
snippet: The New York mayor said he did not believe Americans would turn to billionaires like his predecessor, Michael R. Bloomberg, or Donald J, Trump “to solve problems created by billionaires.”

title: Joni Ernst, Standing Next to Marco Rubio, Is Not Endorsing Anyone
snippet: Ms. Ernst, Iowa’s freshman Republican senator, has promised not endorse anyone in the presidential race, but that didn’t stop her from appearing with Mr. Rubio, her “good friend.”

title: Ted Cruz on Feud With Donald Trump: He Started It
snippet: Mr. Cruz said his sudden antagonism toward Mr. Trump was in response to the real estate developer insulting him every day.

title: John Kasich Relishes Attacks From Jeb Bush Backers in Iowa
snippet: Mr. Kasich seemed surprised, if not delighted, at attacks from Right to Rise, the ‘super PAC’ supporting Jeb Bush, saying it was “fantastic” to be viewed as an encroaching rival in Iowa, where neither candidate is faring well in polls.

title: Trump or Cruz? Clinton or Sanders? Iowa Hears Last-Minute Pitches
snippet: With the caucuses fast approaching, the campaigns are activating the final stage of their ground games in hopes of a strong showing.

title: The Rise and Fall of the Bush Campaign
snippet: Only a year ago, he was a favorite to clinch the Republican nomination. But as Iowa voters prepare for their caucuses, he barely registers in the polls.

title: More Democratic Debates in the Works
snippet: A debate on Thursday, ahead of the New Hampshire primary on Feb. 9, is expected to be sanctioned and sponsored by MSNBC, and the campaigns have been in talks about holding additional debates in March, April and May.

title: Donald Trump Field Organizer Accuses Campaign of Sex Discrimination
snippet: Elizabeth Mae Davidson, 26, the Trump campaign’s former field organizer in Davenport, Iowa, said that men in the same job were paid more than women.

title: Email Issue Dogs Hillary Clinton on Eve of Iowa Caucuses
snippet: On the eve of the Iowa caucuses, Hillary Clinton found herself defending her use of a private email server while serving as secretary of state.

title: Hillary Clinton Campaign Declined Bill de Blasio’s First Offer to Help in Iowa
snippet: Hillary Clinton’s team declined Mayor Bill de Blasio’s initial offer to campaign in Iowa for her candidacy, the New York City mayor said.

title: Bernie Sanders’s Campaign Says It Raised $20 Million in January
snippet: Bernie Sanders’s campaign will announce that it has raised $20 million in the last month, an enormous haul that backs up the campaign’s assertion that it will have enough money for a long, hard fought nominating fight against Hillary Clinton.

title: Bernie Sanders Says Tax Plan Would Not Hurt Democrats’ 2016 Prospects
snippet: Bernie Sanders said on “Meet the Press” that his plan to raise taxes to increase government benefits would not undercut the Democratic Party’s efforts to retake the House in 2016.

title: Our Man in Iowa: Polls Point to Donald Trump, as Do Odd Indicators
snippet: We sent our reporter Trip Gabriel to live in Iowa. Here’s what he’s watching for as the caucuses near.
